item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Trial of Chinese Hotelier Features Accusations of Prostitution
item.description: Liang Yaohui became a multimillionaire before he was targeted in a crackdown on vice and was charged in a prostitution scandal.
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG

item.title: Chinese Weapons Spotted on Disputed Island, U.S. Says
item.description: Artillery vehicles were seen on an artificial island the Chinese are building in the South China Sea, amid tensions between China and its neighbors.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW ROSENBERG

item.title: Photographer Gets Prison Sentence for Swindling L’Oréal Heiress
item.description: François-Marie Banier was found guilty of “abuse of weakness” and money laundering. He was handed a three-year prison sentence with six months suspended.
item.dc:creator: AURELIEN BREEDEN
item.media:description: François-Marie Banier, a celebrity photographer, before hearing the court's verdict in Bordeaux, France, on Thursday.

item.title: The Saturday Profile: Biracial Beauty Queen Strives for Change in Mono-Ethnic Japan
item.description: Ariana Miyamoto, the first half-black Miss Universe Japan, has endured slurs since she was a child. “Even today,” she said, “I am usually seen not as a Japanese but as a foreigner.”
item.dc:creator: MARTIN FACKLER
item.media:credit: Ko Sasaki for The New York Times
item.media:description: Ariana Miyamoto, Miss Universe Japan 2015, said she hoped to spotlight the difficulties that she and other mixed-race citizens face in Japan.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Director Wang Xiaoshuai Sees Worst Time for Independent Films in China
item.description: In a letter, the filmmaker implicitly called out cinema managers for their lack of support for his latest release, “Red Amnesia.”
item.dc:creator: AMY QIN and CHANG CHEN

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Beijing Destroys Confiscated Ivory in Effort to Curb Illegal Trade
item.description: Beijing hopes to reduce the poaching of elephants, which is driven by Chinese consumers’ demand for ivory.
item.category: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species
item.dc:creator: VANESSA PIAO and CHERIE CHAN
item.media:description: A Chinese policeman watching over ivory products before their destruction Friday in Beijing.

item.title: Crisis-Hit FIFA Prepares to Vote on Whether to Keep Sepp Blatter as Chief
item.description: Soccer’s world governing body began a meeting of its congress, with attention focused on an election that was expected to return Mr. Blatter as president.
item.category: Ali bin al-Hussein, Prince of Jordan
item.dc:creator: SAM BORDEN and DAN BILEFSKY
item.media:description: The president of FIFA, Sepp Blatter, standing, and his challenger, Prince Ali bin Al-Hussein, lower left, at the opening of the 65th FIFA Congress in Zurich on Friday.

item.title: U.S. Signals Willingness to Widen Role in Fighting Boko Haram in Nigeria
item.description: Secretary of State John Kerry, in Abuja for the inauguration of Nigeria’s new leader, was expected on Friday to offer increased military assistance.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, center, arriving in Abuja on Friday to attend the inauguration of Muhammadu Buhari as president of Nigeria.

item.title: Explosion Near Shiite Mosque Kills 4 in Eastern Saudi Arabia
item.description: The episode, which officials called an attempted terrorist attack, occurred a week after a similar attack by the Islamic State group killed 21 worshipers.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: Crews at the site of an explosion near a Shiite mosque in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, on Friday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Liao Ran on the Trial of Zhou Yongkang and China’s New Gang of Four
item.description: Liao Ran, a corruption analyst at Transparency International, discusses the fall of Zhou Yongkang, China’s former security chief, and the consolidation of power by President Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:credit: Didi Kirsten Tatlow/The New York Times

item.title: Malaysia Bars Entry to 2nd Hong Kong Activist
item.description: Malaysia denied entry to Leung Kwok-hung, a member of Hong Kong’s legislature, three days after placing the student protest leader Joshua Wong on a blacklist.
item.dc:creator: ALAN WONG
item.media:description: The political activist Leung Kwok-hung during a Labor Day rally on May 1 in Hong Kong.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: The Kremlin vs. The NGOs
item.description: The state's repressive machine won't quit until it has vacuumed up every last bit of independent activity.
item.dc:creator: MASHA GESSEN

item.title: Police Commander From Tajikistan Appears in ISIS Video
item.description: Col. Gulmurod Khalimov, who led an elite police division, vanished last month. In the video, he declares his intention to wage jihad in Central Asia.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ANDREW ROTH

item.title: Myanmar Deflects U.N. Criticism Over Rohingya
item.description: Myanmar said that it should not be singled out for the refugee crisis after the United Nations said that the root cause was Myanmar’s treatment of the Rohingya.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS FULLER

item.title: Volcano Erupts in Southern Japan, Spewing Ash High Into Sky
item.description: A volcano erupted in spectacular fashion on a small island in southern Japan on Friday, spewing out rocks and sending black clouds of ash 9 kilometers (5.6 miles) into the sky. Authorities told people on the island to evacuate.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: Mount Shindake on the island of Kuchinoerabu, Japan, erupted on Friday.

item.title: Sepp Blatter Is Unfazed Entering FIFA Election
item.description: The scandal has not changed the strange electoral math of FIFA: Europe’s support of Prince Ali bin al-Hussein is outweighed by the support of many small countries for Blatter.
item.dc:creator: SAM BORDEN
item.media:description: "We, or I, cannot monitor everyone all of the time. If people want to do wrong, they will also try to hide it," Sepp Blatter told FIFA's annual congress.

item.title: World Briefing: Syria: Insurgent Coalition Pushes Assad’s Forces From a Stronghold
item.description: Insurgents seized one of the last Syrian government positions in the northern province of Idlib on Thursday night.
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD

item.title: World Briefing: Yemen: Amnesty Says Antiaircraft Fire by Houthis Has Killed Many Civilians
item.description: Antiaircraft munitions fired by Yemen’s Houthi rebels have killed or maimed scores of civilians in Sana.
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: 15 Chinese Accused of Using Test-Taking Impostors for College Entrance Exams
item.description: The indictment sketches a scheme in which individuals are accused of paying impostors using fake Chinese passports to take college entrance exams at testing sites in the Pittsburgh area.
item.dc:creator: JESS BIDGOOD

item.title: World Briefing: Switzerland: Scientists Find the Secret to the Holes in Swiss Cheese: Hay Dust
item.description: The mystery of Swiss cheese and its disappearing holes has been solved: The milk is too clean.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
